item.title: Speaking in Objectives: A Professional Parable
item.description: The following story was one my Dad told me many times as a reminder that it is often most effective to explain what you’re trying to accomplish rather than how you want something done. In my early days as a Program Manager, I had a thoughtful manager who took the time to sit with me and put it in the terms of explaining the “what” rather than the “how”. This doesn’t mean we shouldn’t dive deep and work through the complexities of problems, but that we should avoid defining the solution in details that we do not necessarily control.
